column3: Aku is the less formal version of #Saya, and is used in more casual contexts, like with friends acquantainces and people of your same age who you don't need to give a higher level of respect too.
Kamu is the less formal and more common form of #Anda
There are different words to mean No, Not, and Don't.
column6: different ways to say no/not/don't; gak

column3: To refer to something generally near by
To refer to something that isn't within reach

There is also an unrelated grammar rule that adds a prefix "di" attached to words.  This is not the same thing, eventhough people often incorrectly write this form of "di" attached to the following word, which is incorrect and has a different meaning

column2: will, going to, about to; regarding, about
there is, there are; to exist

column3: Used to refer to "us/we" when not including the person you are talking to.  (See also #kita when saying "we/us" but also including the person you're talking to)

column2: no, not; isn't it, aren't you, etc.
again; any more, any longer; more
to be able to; get, obtain
[used to form present continuous]; medium, average
to live, be alive; life; alive
[used for greetings/well-wishing]; congratulations; good luck; safe, unharmed
father; [term of address for own father or respected older man]
a little, a bit; few; slightly
mother; [term of address for own mother or respected older woman]
on top of, above; over; up, upwards; because of
moreover, in fact; on the contrary
[polite way of inviting sb. to do sth.], let's; please, help yourself
how much, how many; how (+ adjective)
unlucky person or thing; damn it!
normal, usual, ordinary; used to, accustomed to
[used to form adverbs], in a [adj.] way
to pull; to attract; interesting, attractive
[suffix added to words to indicate possession]; the
through, via; past, over (in time phrases)
it means, that is to say
a kind of, a type of
sibling; relative; [formal term of address for people of equivalent status]
the reason is, the reason being
related to; to get in touch with, be in contact with
to put out, take out; issue
finished, used up; completely; after that*
to catch fire, be on fire
it is not necessary, there's no point
